text:
Hi,

I'm documenting the use of log4j in one of our products, CapeConnect. In doing 
so, I need to (obviously) cite the name of this logging library. Throughout 
your site and the product documentation, it is referred to as LOG4J, Log4j and 
log4j. Which capitalization is correct? Thanks. DB.
creator: darren.barefoot@capeclear.com
cgu@qos.ch
text:
Darren,

Log4j should be spelled in all lower case, as in log4j, except if the it occurs 
as the first word in a sentence, like in this sentence.

I added this to the FAQ.

ps: Are you pulling my leg?

creator: darren.barefoot@capeclear.com
text:
Actually, I'm not pulling your leg. Us technical writers are pretty pedantic, 
and like to get the details (where, as they say, the devil is) correct. Thanks 
for the reply. DB.
